channel.title: Projects on Jun Woo Shin
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Jun Woo Shin

item.title: CHIP8
item.description: GitHub: chip8 Demo: N/A I’ve always been interested in emulation - it seemed incredible that we could bring back past hardware and software.

item.title: Rainbow GIF
item.description: GitHub: rainbowgif Demo: N/A I’m a huge fan of Slack’s custom emojis and the various collections that have surfaced.

item.title: C Snake
item.description: GitHub: snake Demo: N/A As I was an avid user of terminal applications as well as command line applications, I came to learn about ncurses, a TUI library.

item.title: Game of Life
item.description: GitHub: game of life Demo: N/A Functional programming always piqued my interest so I wanted to take the time to learn one and use it in a project.

item.title: Chrome Storage
item.description: GitHub: chrome storage Demo: N/A The Chrome brower has a storage API for storing data, acting as a sort of database for the extensions and now deprecated applications.

item.title: Todo
item.description: GitHub: todo Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_todo/ Having started off as a web developer, I always wanted to stay on top of the current frameworks.

item.title: Another Shell
item.description: GitHub: ash Demo: N/A I’ve been using the commandline for a while, especially Bash but I never thought about how they had been developed or their inner workings.

item.title: Slack Zmachine
item.description: GitHub: slack zmachine Demo: N/A This is a simple slack bot to allow users to play zmachine text based games through Slack.

item.title: GitSync
item.description: GitHub: GitSync Demo: N/A GitSync is an application to sync between a remote Git source and a local Git source.

item.title: JavaScript Frotz
item.description: GitHub: JavaScript Frotz Demo: N/A Frotz is a zmachine interpreter for text based games, such as Zork.

item.title: Clock
item.description: GitHub: clock Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_clock/ This is a simple clock that I made. I had planned on making it much fancier with smooth animations and better styling but this is just what I ended up with!

item.title: Diceware
item.description: GitHub: diceware Demo: N/A After reading an article about a little girl making diceware passwords and selling them, I became interested in automating that process.

item.title: Geocoder
item.description: GitHub: geocoder Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_geocoder/ I was playing around with Google’s location API, when I found the geocoding API.
